content.question: Goldfarb, in Source 2, most directly supports her claim that the British press during the First World War routinely suppressed important war news by citing

choices.label: letters by soldiers complaining of the incompetence of their leaders
rewards given to journalists by the British government
the more obtrusive press censorship of German authorities
the case of the sinking of a battleship and the Battle of Jutland

content.answer: the case of the sinking of a battleship and the Battle of Jutland

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Identify the evidence used in a source to support an argument.
